page.title: 06BRIGHSTONE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: We spoke to a resident of Brighstone about her duties as a pariah councillor. She told us that she and seven others represented the 1500_1600 people living in the parish.In her 23 years of service the population has doubled. Every month they meet to discuss matters ranging from footpaths to tidiness!They also raise money and put this to a variety of amenities. For example they have bought a recreation ground and a permanent library for the village.(This is instead of the mobile library that used to serve the village.) It is the job of the parish council to take complaints to the county council in Newport. A common one is about the roads! The councillor we spoke to combined this chore with her weekly shopping trip to Newport.
